result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew D Galica was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Must take any prescriptions in strict conformity with orders of prescribing physician. Any counseling and/or assessments deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must complete GED or HSED. May not associate with any known drug dealers or users. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 27, 2017 at 10:30 am.
*amended*
Sentencing hearing on October 27, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Andrew D Galica in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
Parties have received/reviewed PSI. Defense indicates the PSI gives recommendations to both Ct 1 and Ct 2. Ct 2 was DRI. Defense asks for the PSI to be redone. The State concurs.

The State notes there are numerous violates noted by RCAP. Defense indicates that deft is working with Justice Point in Milwaukee and he has had clean tests there. Defense indicates deft is on probation in Milwaulee and that agent told deft he needs to get into treatment to address his AODA needs. The State does not ask for an increase today mostly because deft is on probation. The State will contact the agent in Milwaukee. If there is a positive test prior to SEH, the State will ask for an increase in bond.

BTC: PSI to be redone, SEH to be reschedule  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Margaret Johnson

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victim store, Home Depot, except for restitution purposes.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator) between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Preliminary hearing at 01-13-2016 08:30 am

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victim store, Home Depot, except for restitution purposes.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
